title: How to Make Spicy Garlic Bread

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees and put your rack on the 2nd or 3rd rung from the top.
steps.description: You want it just above the center of the oven.

steps.headline: Set up a cookie sheet with a sheet of foil on it to make for easier cleanup.
Get 1/2 a loaf of French, sourdough, or wheat baguette, your choice.
steps.description: It does not have to be fresh, and tastes equally good with day-old bread.

steps.headline: Slice the baguette lengthwise in half, then score it (shallow cuts-don't separate!)
steps.description: into 'slices' of about 3–5 inches (7.6–12.7 cm) long, depending on how many people you're serving. Split half of a long baguette, with 3 pieces each to share between two.

steps.headline: Take a coffee cup or bowl, mix about 3–4 tablespoon (44–59 ml) of good olive oil with 2-3 tsp of chopped garlic (fresh or from a jar).
steps.description: Do not use garlic powder! If you run out, feel free to add more of each. It's all to your taste.

steps.headline: Put your bread on the cookie sheet, then using your spoon, spread the garlic mixture over the long, scored halves of the baguette
Use your favorite spice.
steps.description: Joe's Hot Stuff is delicious. Some other options include: Emeril's Essence, All-purpose spice, Mexican seasoning, and dried red pepper flakes. Choose what you like best!

steps.headline: Bake the bread for 5-6 minutes, depending on thickness and newness.
steps.description: If the bread is fresh or thick (1.5-2 inches thick), then it'll need a bit longer baking time (5-6 min).

steps.headline: Leave the bread in the oven, switch to the broiler setting and broil for 2 minutes.
steps.description: It will dramatically change color then. Don't burn it! If in doubt, check after a minute.

text: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees and put your rack on the 2nd or 3rd rung from the top. You want it just above the center of the oven. Set up a cookie sheet with a sheet of foil on it to make for easier cleanup.  Get 1/2 a loaf of French, sourdough, or wheat baguette, your choice. It does not have to be fresh, and tastes equally good with day-old bread. Slice the baguette lengthwise in half, then score it (shallow cuts-don't separate!) into 'slices' of about 3–5 inches (7.6–12.7 cm) long, depending on how many people you're serving. Split half of a long baguette, with 3 pieces each to share between two. Take a coffee cup or bowl, mix about 3–4 tablespoon (44–59 ml) of good olive oil with 2-3 tsp of chopped garlic (fresh or from a jar). Do not use garlic powder! If you run out, feel free to add more of each. It's all to your taste. Put your bread on the cookie sheet, then using your spoon, spread the garlic mixture over the long, scored halves of the baguette  Use your favorite spice. Joe's Hot Stuff is delicious. Some other options include: Emeril's Essence, All-purpose spice, Mexican seasoning, and dried red pepper flakes. Choose what you like best! Bake the bread for 5-6 minutes, depending on thickness and newness. If the bread is fresh or thick (1.5-2 inches thick), then it'll need a bit longer baking time (5-6 min). Leave the bread in the oven, switch to the broiler setting and broil for 2 minutes. It will dramatically change color then. Don't burn it! If in doubt, check after a minute. Serve and enjoy!
